thread.title: New Asterix sees duo fight propaganda war
thread.title_full: New Asterix sees duo fight propaganda war

title: New Asterix sees duo fight propaganda war
text:
New Asterix sees duo fight propaganda war 1:43pm BST - 01:23 
A new Asterix album sees the famous duo fight their Roman foes in a propaganda war with an ally inspired by Julian Assange. Helena Williams reports.   
The Gauls are back. But this time, Asterix and Obelix are fighting their Roman foes in a propaganda war, alongside an unlikely ally -- a character inspired by Wikileaks founder Julian Assange. SOUNDBITE (French) Asterix scriptwriter, Jean-Yves Ferri, saying: "I really think it will (please Asterix fans), because it respects everything that the Asterix world encompasses, and some new things as well, we have tried to find new facets of the characters' personalities." Loyal fans were drawn to the midnight launch of "Asterix and the Missing Scroll" in Paris on Wednesday, lining up to to get their personalised edition of the hugely popular comic book. SOUNDBITE (French) Asterix fan, Franck Beget, saying: "It reminds me of my childhood memories and it is really a cult series, so I would really go to great lengths to have a drawing by one of the authors." SOUNDBITE (French) Asterix fan, Antonio Bivar, saying: "You know, when I was young this series was really excellent, very funny, you would learn a lot of things because it is full of culture, and it is just so funny, the finest humour that I will ever come across." The 36th book in the series comes two years after the unlikely heroes' last adventure in ancient Scotland. The comics were created in 1959 and have sold more than 350 million copies worldwide.  //reut.rs/200glUt
